Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as f2988977efb4ad8da523b6563b3f4cdbcd2469ed
Looks good in general - some feedback on a potential memory leak, and a bunch of really minor things.
minor: you have some odd spacing around the = here.
Do we need these here, or in the .c?
arj hates it when I do that, so strong ACK on this part 😄

Hey, blame clang-format!

I'm trying to incrementally get the code consistently formatted. Slowly removing entries from .clang-ignore :/
this seems to have been re-wrapped, is that the correct layout?

Yep, that would be consistent with the existing uses; and allows embedded implementations to provide their own allocator .

(It's unlikely that we'll be running the pcap code in those situations, but consistency is good...)
+1 for consistency, otherwise not using it will eventually bleed into areas where we do care :)
Maybe we call this `outgoing` to align with LINUX_SLL_OUTGOING?
If only there was pcap_dumpv() or something :(
I'm wondering whether we leave these in place and make them just issue a log message saying they're deprecated for now?

So we have bools here, and that's fine, however how do you feel about adding macros for true/false that help describe the direction at the point of invocation. For example:

 #define MCTP_CAPTURE_OUTGOING true
 #define MCTP_CAPTURE_INCOMING false

We've done similar over here: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libmctp/+/57959/9/libmctp.h#40

Happy to bikeshed the names :) Also happy to take the idea in a later patch.

I think macros would make usage of this less error prone. As far as I can see they would need to be added into libmctp.h as well -- is it reasonable to add these macros in the library header file for such a small thing?
We can always add them later if we feel we need them.
